p: Due to the urgent need for effective drugs to attenuate the disease, and the long-lasting process of novel drug development, researchers are focusing on “drug repositioning”. Among the drugs approved or developed for other purposes that have been proposed for the treatment of SARS-CoV-2 and are under clinical trials, most are enzyme inhibitors, targeting the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RDRP) or the protease of the virus. Among them, favipinavir, ribavirin, remdesivir and galidesivir act as RDRP inhibitors while lopinavir, ritonavir [ 5, 6] and danoprevir are viral protease inhibitors. In addition, drugs aiming to prevent the entrance and formation of the viral particles have been proposed, such as chloroquine, hydroxychloroquine [ 7] and APN01 [ 8].
